title: The Appointed Festivals
summary: Leviticus 23 outlines the sacred festivals of Israel: the Sabbath, Passover, Unleavened Bread, Firstfruits, Pentecost, Trumpets, the Day of Atonement, and Tabernacles. These festivals mark times of worship, rest, and remembrance.

faq.question: Why were these festivals important?

faq.question: What was the Day of Atonement?
faq.answer: A solemn day of fasting and cleansing from sin, observed once a year.
